clinical_study.brief_title: Bimanual Training in Children With Hemiplegia
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized Clinical Trial of Hand Arm Bimanual Intensive Therapy (HABIT)

brief_summary.textblock: A randomized control trial of bimanual training in children with hemiplegia. The protocols have been developed at Columbia University to be child friendly and draws upon our experience since 1997 with constraint-induced movement therapy in children with cerebral palsy. The investigators will test the hypothesis that bimanual training (HABIT) will result in improved hand function in children with hemiplegia.

detailed_description.textblock: A new treatment involving bimanual (Hand-Arm Bimanual Intensive Therapy (HABIT). The protocols have been developed at Columbia University to be child friendly and draws upon our experience since 1997 with constraint-induced movement therapy in children with cerebral palsy. The investigators developed HABIT in 2004 as an alternative to constraint-therapy that avoids use of a restraint. The interventions are performed in a 15 day day-camp setting with several children and at least one therapist per child. The investigators have conducted 24 day camps to date since 2002, and are now collaborating with clinicians worldwide to expand our treatment availability. The aim is to promote the use of and improve the coordination of movement of both hands together. PARTICIPATION IS FREE. Please check out our website for more information: http://www.tc.edu/centers/cit/

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in quality of bimanual hand use at 12 months
primary_outcome.description: Changes in quality of how the two hands are used during manual activity as determined from video analysis.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in manual dexterity at 12 months
primary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in timed performance of standardized manual activities

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in upper extremity strength at 12 months
Change from baseline in range of upper extremity motion at 12 months
Change from baseline in goal achievement at 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: Change in caregiver ratings of activities identified as important goals by the caregiver

arm_group.arm_group_label: Ongoing usual and customary rehabilitation care
arm_group.description: Subjects are tested over 6 months while receiving their ongoing usual and customary care schedule of physical and occupational therapy or following constraint-induced movement therapy received as usual and customary care independent of the study, and then are crossed-over to receive HABIT.

intervention.description: 90 hours of bimanual training over 3 weeks in a day camp environment
intervention.other_name: constraint-induced movement therapy, bimanual training, occupational therapy, physical therapy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
*willingness to agree to intervention and testing procedures and travel to the University for participation and testing
Exclusion Criteria:
- health problems not associated with CP
- uncontrollable seizures
- visual problems that would interfere with carrying out the intervention or testing
- botulinum toxin therapy in the upper extremity musculature during the last six months or who wish to receive it within the period of study
